p: One study showed that among patients infected with SARS‐CoV‐2, patients with malignant tumors progress to severe disease more rapidly than noncancer patients (13 vs. 43 days, P < 0.0001). The number of severe cases was approximately five times higher in cancer patients than in the general population (39% vs. 8%, P = 0.0003). 3 In addition, lung cancer patients are more susceptible to COVID‐19 since they are usually elderly patients and smokers and have low immunity, poor nutritional status and poor lung conditions. Thus, they need to be well protected from COVID‐19. Conversely, some advanced lung cancer patients need to receive regular antitumor treatment due to the high tumor burden and deal with treatment‐related adverse events.
